TopicTitle: Game Informer and Maxmaps take a look at 0.25

Articles.Content:
<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1rBneN1"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/e57070bed1c38940564f251c6637f8aa/tumblr_inline_ncub8nnmeX1rr2wit.jpg"/></a></p>

<p>Have a hankering to see what’s on the menu for the upcoming 0.25 update? <strong>Game Informer</strong> and <strong>Maxmaps</strong> are here to give you an overview of what’s to come in a brand new preview <a href="http://bit.ly/1rBneN1"><strong>VIDEO</strong></a>.</p>

Great video, but the quality wasn't as great. Will a better-quality version appear on YouTube soon? Also, love the addition of the feature to disable surface attachment. That'll help soooo much Thanks!

Edited October 2, 2014 by mythbusters844
"Big plans" in the vein of destructible buildings, eh? Sounds promising.
Looks like a pretty awesome update to me. Several community suggestions were added too!

Looks pretty good, aside from the aforementioned needless and gratuitous destruction. Happy to see the navball getting improved and the space center markers are quite nice. I'd love to know exactly which SpacePlane+ parts (or even if all of them...) actually made it into the game but I suppose the update is almost upon us.

Do certain parts prevent transfer of Kerbals through them? Is the part tree traversed or do you simply put the Kerbals directly into the clicked part? Gonna be hilarious to cram Kerbals through a KAS pipe if it's just a simple transfer.

Thanks for the video, it would be nice if there was an HD version somewhere. I couldn't see anything on that.

It looks like they didn't fix the ridiculously thin cargo bay walls. That is disappointing. Despite that the parts do look great.

Edited October 3, 2014 by Alshain
Please, next time try to put your videos in YouTube, along with whatever place you put them. That video quality was bad, and also lots of stream issues.
Other then the Hum. Video being to small. Looks like it will be intresting to play with dem new parts. =^.^=
dat crew transfer
The crew transfer makes me wonder if the hatch click bug was ever fixed for us OS-X weirdos.....

Do certain parts prevent transfer of Kerbals through them? Is the part tree traversed or do you simply put the Kerbals directly into the clicked part? Gonna be hilarious to cram Kerbals through a KAS pipe if it's just a simple transfer.

I feel like this is in the same vein as fuel transfer, and I'd like to see it addressed at some point. You should only be able to transfer fuel through certain parts, and the same for Kerbals. But for now, I have a feeling Kerbals can instantly teleport to any part of the ship. I wonder if includes external command seats...

I feel like this is in the same vein as fuel transfer, and I'd like to see it addressed at some point. You should only be able to transfer fuel through certain parts, and the same for Kerbals. But for now, I have a feeling Kerbals can instantly teleport to any part of the ship. I wonder if includes external command seats...

I will be seeing the crew transfer feature like I do the fuel one. An ease of function function. I`ll suspend my disbelief and assume the kerbals can squeeze through very small gaps like an octopus in the way that I imagine small fuel channels built in to most parts for the fuel. I have the ability to alter the flow of time for my own benefit, I`ll assume I can move kerbals about within a craft when I could EVA them just as easily. I think I`ll imagine some form of plunger device to move them between pods in very small tubes. In the real world we have moved crew between docked craft but never transferred fuel AFAIK. Maybe one of the difficulty settings could be to restrict the parts that will allow fuel and crew transfer?

What I would really like is the ability to decide which seat a kerbal is sat in. Maybe drop and drag.

Do certain parts prevent transfer of Kerbals through them? Is the part tree traversed or do you simply put the Kerbals directly into the clicked part? Gonna be hilarious to cram Kerbals through a KAS pipe if it's just a simple transfer.

I had the exact same question. The parts in the demonstration craft should all be passable, but whether that's a requirement or just coincidence is unclear.

Glad to see radial attachment disabling added to stock, I use it all the time in Editor Extensions. Almost a requirement for working with the cargo bays.
The next update looks like it has a great feature set. I also liked the KSP logo at the end, it would make a good splash screen for loading KSP. Whoever was working on it did a great job
Am i the Only one that is excited about the collapsible buildings because those animations were awesome!

Am i the Only one that is excited about the collapsible buildings because those animations were awesome!

You are not the only one! I can't wait to blow up avoid those buildings!

I think I`ll imagine some form of plunger device to move them between pods in very small tubes. In the real world we have moved crew between docked craft but never transferred fuel AFAIK.

Fuel is transferred from visiting vehicles to ISS on a regular basis.
I can see an early competition between the "top" KSP You Tubers now: destroying every last building at the KSC in one shot, with the least amount of explosives, er, fuel & oxidizer.
I'm almost drooling just looking at the new effects. Granted, I knew about these already, but to finally see some of them in action is a beautiful thing!
Looks good. Can't wait for this to be out.

Fuel is transferred from visiting vehicles to ISS on a regular basis.

Yes, but they don't pump it through the girders and trusses.

In any case, I'm in the "I'll happily suspend my disbelief if it means I don't have to play the EVA Shuffle game."
Will we be able to transfer Kerbals between seats as well?

Science transfer, too?

That would be one more mod I didn't have to install.

I didnt really got it.

What was this key binding from 2 minute about?
Whoa! You can select crafts landed in the KSC, cool!
